55 | 2024-06-24 | NOTICE OF APPEAL as to 52 Order on Motion for Partial Summary Judgment,,, Order on Motion to Strike,, by All Plaintiffs. Filing Fee PAID $605, receipt number AWIEDC-4706609 (cc: all counsel) (New, Stephen)
59 | 2024-06-25 | USCA Case Number 24-2086 re: 55 Notice of Appeal. (lmf)

extracted.value: Appeal: All Plaintiffs appealed to U.S. Court of Appeals (Case No. 24-2086).

evidence.text: 13 | 2023-11-20 | SCREENING ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 11/20/2023 re 1 Plaintiffs' Proposed Class Action Complaint. Plaintiffs' demands for compensatory and punitive damages are DISMISSED, as all defendants are being sued only in their official capacities. The defendants shall answer or otherwise respond to the remainder of the complaint, as to the injunctive relief requested, within 21 days of this order. (cc: all counsel)(lz)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin issued a Screening Order on November 20, 2023, dismissing compensatory and punitive damages claims as defendants are sued in official capacities, requiring defendants to answer on injunctive relief within 21 days.

evidence.text: 42 | 2024-05-03 | TEXT ONLY ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 5/3/2024. The motion to stay (ECF No. 33 ) is GRANTED as unopposed. (cc: all counsel)(lz)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin granted the Defendants' Motion to Stay on May 3, 2024, as the motion was unopposed, pending a decision on the Motion for Partial Summary Judgment.

evidence.text: 51 | 2024-05-21 | TEXT ONLY ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 5/21/2024. The plaintiffs' motion for an extension of time (ECF No. 46) is GRANTED. The deadline for the plaintiffs' expert disclosure is extended by 60 days. (cc: all counsel)(lz)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin granted the Plaintiffs' Motion for Extension of Time on May 21, 2024, extending the deadline for expert disclosure by 60 days.

evidence.text: 52 | 2024-05-23 | DECISION AND ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 5/23/2024 GRANTING 29 Defendants' Motion for Partial Summary Judgment on Exhaustion Grounds; and GRANTING 49 Defendants' Motion to Strike Plaintiffs' Affidavits (ECF Nos. 43, 44, 45, 48). Patrick Kurkowski, Kenneth Dalberg, Edgar Salinas-Leal, Bradley Schmitt, Justin Welch, Ashton Dreiling, John Anderson, and Jayvon Flemming are DISMISSED as plaintiffs. The plaintiffs' mental health and isolation-related claims are DISMISSED. (cc: all counsel)(lz)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin granted the Defendants' Motion for Partial Summary Judgment on Exhaustion Grounds and granted the Motion to Strike Plaintiffs' Affidavits on May 23, 2024, dismissing certain plaintiffs and their mental health and isolation-related claims.

evidence.text: 53 | 2024-06-04 | DECISION AND ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 6/4/2024. The plaintiffs' motion for a preliminary injunction (ECF No. 28 ) is denied. The plaintiffs' motion for class certification (ECF No. 34 ) is denied. (cc: all counsel)(mlm)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin denied the Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction and Motion for Class Certification on June 4, 2024.

evidence.text: 62 | 2024-07-22 | TEXT ONLY ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge William E Duffin on 7/22/2024. The motion to stay (ECF No. 60 ) is DISMISSED AS MOOT. (cc: all counsel)(lz)

extracted.value: Magistrate Judge William E Duffin dismissed the Defendants' Motion to Stay as moot on July 22, 2024, after the appeal was dismissed.

evidence.text: 55 | 2024-06-24 | NOTICE OF APPEAL as to 52 Order on Motion for Partial Summary Judgment,,, Order on Motion to Strike,, by All Plaintiffs. Filing Fee PAID $605, receipt number AWIEDC-4706609 (cc: all counsel) (New, Stephen)

extracted.value: All Plaintiffs filed a Notice of Appeal on June 24, 2024, appealing the district court's orders on summary judgment and motion to strike.

evidence.text: Case Terminated without prejudice, with each side to bear its own costs and fees pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1)(A)(ii). See ECF No 63 Stipulation of Voluntary Dismissal.
